summary: The 'No Taxation Without Representation Act of 2025' requires the President to obtain Congressional approval before imposing duties on imported goods.  It amends the Trade Act of 1974, outlining the process for presidential proposals and Congressional review. The bill specifies various laws to which this requirement applies, including the Tariff Act of 1930 and international trade agreements, but exempts embargoes. It also includes a clerical amendment to the Trade Act of 1974's table of contents.
